intro: Ruellia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradox ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Ruellia paradoxa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
